title: WfExS-backend stage definition
description: WfExS-backend stage definition file (EOSC-Life Demonstrator 7 JSON Schemas)

member.description: For fetched directories and archives (zip, tar, etc...), the internal member(s) to use instead of the whole resource.

name.description: The name of the internal resource. Both glob patterns and exact matches are accepted.

as.description: The local name to use, instead of the derived one from the name. If a glob pattern is used and more than one element matches, it is the name of the directory where all the matches are stored

items.description: URL to the description of the licence of the data. And by default, no permission to use or distribute it

pid.description: A unique way to represent this author, either through her/his ORCID or another permanent, representative link

items.documentation: The valid roles come from CASRAI CRediT, and can be visited through http://credit.niso.org/contributor-roles/{term}/

security-context.documentation: The name of the optional security context to be used to authenticate in order to reach the resource

oneOf.description: This element is an array of alternate URLs, so any of them provide the very same resources

value.description: When 'c-l-a-s-s' is a single file or a value, the assigned value

tabular.description: When it is content with URIs, we are telling it is a tabular one with this key. URIs are fetched, and the absolute paths replace them in the generated content tab

uri-columns.description: The columns where URIs to be fetched are found

row-sep.description: The string used to split the tabulated content by rows

column-sep.description: The regular expression used to split the tabulated content by columns

header-rows.description: How many header rows should be skipped?

url.description: The URL(s) / URI(s) where this input is available

secondary-urls.description: Secondary URLs / URIs are pointing to contents which will feed secondary inputs (CWL concept)

preferred-name.description: Preferred base name / relative path for this input, instead of the derived one from the URL

relative-dir.description: Put contents fetched for this input in this relative directory. This option does not affect preferred-name

security-context.description: Use an explicitly named security context

disclosable.description: Whether this input contents can be included in RO-Crates or exported

cacheable.description: Whether a copy of this input contents can be kept locally outside the working directory

clonable.description: Whether a copy of this input contents can be kept locally inside the working directory

globExplode.description: When this is set, and the class is directory, it helps filtering in what it should be included

autoFill.description: When this key is true, the directory or file is considered an output one

autoPrefix.description: When autoFill is true and this parameter is false, this directory is mapped to the parent output one for this execution. When both autoFill and this parameter are true, an output file or directory name is assigned, based on its complete param name

trs_endpoint.title: The optional TRS endpoing
trs_endpoint.description: If this key is set, it will tell the GA4GH TRS service where to look for the workflow_id (and optional version)

version.title: Workflow version
version.description: If trs_enpoint key is set, it will tell the version of the workflow_id to look for at GA4GH TRS

prefer_upstream_source.title: Prefer upstream source for the workflow, if available
prefer_upstream_source.description: Prefer discovered and recommended upstream source for the workflow (if available) instead of the initially requested one, which can happen in cascade. This is needed for cases where the workflow is incomplete in the initially proposed source, and it is a somewhat known fact

nickname.title: A friendly nickname (prefix) for the instances

workflow_type.title: The optional, forced workflow type
workflow_type.description: When this key is set, it is forcing the workflow type. WfExS-backend is usually able to identify the workflow type, unless there are two intertwined workflows in the same location

containerType.title: Container technology type to be used for this workflow
containerType.description:
Type of container technology to be used when this staging scenario is instantiated. Supported types are:
- Singularity (default).
- Docker.
- Podman
- No containerisation technology (discouraged, but needed for some workflows)
Encrypted working directories are unsupported when Docker or Podman are used due technological limitations

maxRetries.title: Retries in docker mode
maxRetries.description:
Retries when `engineMode` is `docker`.
Retries system was introduced when using docker-in-docker pattern because an insidious
bug happens sometimes. See https://forums.docker.com/t/any-known-problems-with-symlinks-on-bind-mounts/32138

maxProcesses.title: (deprecated) Max number of CPUs
maxProcesses.description: Number of CPUs to be used by Nextflow. When this key has an explicit value of `null`, it depends on Nextflow criteria, which tries creating as many processes as available CPUs, spawning jobs in parallel. Not declaring it, or declaring and explicit value, imposes a limitation in the number of concurrent processes

maxCPUs.title: (deprecated) Max number of CPUs
maxCPUs.description: Number of CPUs to be used by Nextflow. When this key has an explicit value of `null`, it depends on Nextflow criteria, which tries creating as many processes as available CPUs, spawning jobs in parallel. Not declaring it, or declaring and explicit value, imposes a limitation in the number of concurrent processes

maxTaskDuration.title: Max task duration
maxTaskDuration.description: With this parameter it is possible to override the max task time declared for processes. This is needed for workflows which are not so customizable

profile.description: (deprecated) If defined, the profile/s to enable
For engines which support profiles, like Nextflow or snakemake, if defined, the profile/s to enable

^[^=\\0]+$.description: The name of an environment variable. These names cannot contain either the equal or the character \0

preferredName.description: Preferred name for this output, honored when either filledFrom or glob are used

fillFrom.description: Autofilled input from where to get the files and directories to be assigned to this output, useful in workflow models where outputs are not explicitly declared (Nextflow, Snakemake)

syntheticOutput.description: Is this output a synthetic one? The default value when it is not defined depends on the type of workflow.

glob.description: Glob pattern to get the files and directories to be assigned to this output, useful in workflow models where outputs are not explicitly declared (Nextflow, Snakemake)

default_actions.$comment: It should be '$ref': 'https://www.eosc-life.eu/d7/WfExS-backend/Export-Actions#/$defs/ExportsBlock', but the documentation generator complains
